p: Inherently, an inefficient transport system presents multiple constraints for the rural agriculture sector. This is in terms of raising the cost inputs into the production process as well as through delaying the sale of harvested crops (Fan 2004). Furthermore, investment in infrastructure is essential to stimulate the rural non-farm economy and (re)vitalise rural towns, as well as to facilitate the integration of marginal, peripheral and disadvantaged rural areas into national and international economies (Pinstrup-Anderson & Shimokawa 2010).
